4.7 Incident Investigations

The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environment. The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant trains employees to identify and report any and all incidents requiring investigation. An investigation team is assembled and the investigation is initiated within 48 hours of the incident. The results of the investigation are documented, recommendations are resolved, and appropriate process enhancements are implemented.

4.8 Chemical-specific Prevention Steps  Process chemicals

Industry standards are followed at The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant to help ensure safe handling of process chemicals. The vendor supplies chlorine and sulfur dioxide via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton cylinders. The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes. Workers who perform operations involving chlorine and sulfur dioxide receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.0	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment. The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment. The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel will coordinate with local emergency response agencies and first responders to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.

2.0 Description of The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant and Regulated Substances

The Brunswick-Glynn Co. Joint Water & Sewer Commission Academy Creek Water Pollution Control Plant handles two substances regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity. These substances are:

* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for disinfection of the water.
* Sulfur dioxide- stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for dechlorination of water.
